name: B. Perfecto
statement:
A permutation p of length n^{
text{ }} is if, for each index i (1
le i
le n), it satisfies the following: The sum of the first i elements p_1 +
p_2 +
ldots + p_i is a perfect square^{
text{ }}. You would like things to be perfect. Given a positive integer
n, find a permutation of length n, or print -1 if none exists.^{
text{ }}A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct
integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a
permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2 appears twice in the
array), and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3 but there is 4 in the
array). ^{
text{ }}A perfect square is an integer that is the square of an integer,
e.g., 9=3^2 is a perfect square, but 8 and 14 are not.
